what: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
text: chcRne package developed organize functions, useful code snippets, information relevant Research Evaluation team Center Healthy Communities.

title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
text: Functions section used used data management. pnta.unanswered..miss() Sets options (vars) select apply questions NA “Prefer answer” option selected.

title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
text: Functions section return statistics often used expalnations figures. Many functions often used inline code. count_and_percent() Returns string includes total count percentage categories input variable.

title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
text: Functions section used creation figures, tables, visualizations. nperc_tbl_MATA() Creates table showing n counts percentages option mark apply question. Link package description:

title: Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
Functions and code snippets for the R&E team at the CHC
code: library(chcRne)  cols <- c("no_goingout_cooking", "no_goingout_broke") rnames <- c("I like cooking", "I am a broke college student")  # Create table that reports n count and percent for a mark all that apply question table1 <- nperc_tbl_MATA(df = exp.data,                vars = cols,                value = "1",                row.names = rnames,                punc = ".",                col.title = "Why not go out to eat?") table1 count_and_percent(var = exp.data$no_goingout_cooking, "1") ## [1] "11 (55.0%)"

Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
text: function creates table showing n counts percentages option mark apply question.

title: Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
code: nperc_tbl_MATA(df, vars, value, row.names, punc, col.title = "")

title: Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
text: df data frame used create table. vars character vector variable names include table (vars binary). value value rows `vars` (one value across variables). row.names name row table. equivalent option select apply question punc punctuation end row names. col.title name first column table.

title: Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
text: frequency table

title: Creates frequency table — nperc_tbl_MATA
code: # Save the variable names ti questions and the names of the questions to rnames cols <- c("no_goingout_cooking", "no_goingout_broke") rnames <- c("I like cooking", "I am a broke college student")  nperc_tbl_MATA(df = exp.data,                vars = cols,                value = "1",                row.names = rnames,                punc = ".",                col.title = "Why not go out to eat?") #> Error in nperc_tbl_MATA(df = exp.data, vars = cols, value = "1", row.names = rnames,     punc = ".", col.title = "Why not go out to eat?"): object 'rnames' not found

title: PNTA to NA — pnta.unanswered.to.miss
text: function sets options (vars) select apply question NA "Prefer answer" option selected

title: PNTA to NA — pnta.unanswered.to.miss
PNTA to NA — pnta.unanswered.to.miss
text: data data frame interest. prefix prefix used identify relevant columns. pnta variable contains "Prefer answer" option.

title: PNTA to NA — pnta.unanswered.to.miss
text: modified data frame NA assigned cells specified columns rows PNTA responses.

title: PNTA to NA — pnta.unanswered.to.miss
code: pnta.unanswered.to.miss(data = exp.data,                                   prefix = "no_going",                                   pnta = exp.data$Q3) #>                      Q3 no_goingout_cooking no_goingout_broke #> 1                  <NA>                   1                 1 #> 2  Prefer not to answer                  NA                NA #> 3                  <NA>                   1                 0 #> 4  Prefer not to answer                  NA                NA #> 5                  <NA>                   0                 1 #> 6                  <NA>                   1                 0 #> 7                  <NA>                  NA                NA #> 8                  <NA>                   1                 1 #> 9                  <NA>                   0                 1 #> 10                 <NA>                  NA                NA #> 11                 <NA>                   1                 0 #> 12 Prefer not to answer                  NA                NA #> 13 Prefer not to answer                  NA                NA #> 14                 <NA>                  NA                NA #> 15                 <NA>                   1                 1 #> 16                 <NA>                   0                 1 #> 17 Prefer not to answer                  NA                NA #> 18                 <NA>                   1                 1 #> 19                 <NA>                   1                 0 #> 20                 <NA>                   1                 1
